qas.question: What was the main component of Japanese sailor's diet?
What is the scientific term for beriberi?
What major symptom other than heart problems did beriberi cause?
Who made the observation that the Japanese sailor's diet was the cause for them developing beriberi?
What was introduced to the diet on a molecular level that prevented the sailors from contracting the disease?

context: In the early 1880s, <a3_0>Kanehiro Takaki<a3_0/> observed that Japanese sailors (whose diets consisted almost entirely of <a0_0>white rice<a0_0/>) developed beriberi (or <a1_0>endemic neuritis<a1_0/>, a disease causing heart problems and <a2_0>paralysis<a2_0/>), but British sailors and Japanese naval officers did not. Adding various types of vegetables and meats to the diets of Japanese sailors prevented the disease, (not because of the increased protein as Takaki supposed but because it introduced a few parts per million of <a4_0>thiamine<a4_0/> to the diet, later understood as a cure).
